title: Michael Ledeen (August 1, 1941 - May 18, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Michael Ledeen (August 1, 1941 - May 18, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into historian Michael Ledeen (August 1, 1941 - May 18, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his NY Sun obituary at the following link: https://www.nysun.com/article/scholar-and-journalist-michael-ledeen-dies-at-83-after-a-long-career-struggling-for-american-ideals-at-home-and-abroad

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any document(s) sufficient to show the amount(s) budgeted for attorneys' fees and costs in connection with Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

2. All invoices from Roper, Townsend & Sutphen, P.A. in connection with Naples Pride or Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

3. All invoices from Dickman Law Firm in connection with Naples Pride or Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

3. Any non-privileged emails sent by (a) any member of the City Council, (b) the Mayor, or (c) the Vice-Mayor on or after May 1, 2025, which mention any of these terms: "pride", "drag", "ACLU", "liberty".

4. Any non-privileged text messages or other communications (excluding emails) sent or received by (a) any member of the City Council, (b) the Mayor, or (c) the Vice-Mayor on or after May 1, 2025, which mention any of these terms: "pride", "drag", "ACLU", "liberty".

"Communications" means and includes text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Diversity Statistics for Productions Receiving IL Film Tax Credit (2021–Present)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Diversity Statistics for Productions Receiving IL Film Tax Credit (2021–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Related to the Illinois Film Production Services Tax Credit program:

All diversity statistics and related forms submitted by productions that were approved for and received the Illinois Film Production Services Tax Credit from January 1, 2021, through the date of this request.

Specifically, I am seeking:

The diversity report(s) or workforce demographic summary tracking sheets submitted by each approved production, which include data on race/ethnicity, gender, and job categories of employees or contractors hired.

Any standardized forms or summaries required under Section M (or equivalent) of the film tax credit application.

The name of the production, name of the production company, and year of submission associated with each record.

If these records are compiled in a spreadsheet, database export, or summary report, I would prefer to receive those formats (e.g., Excel, CSV, or PDF), but I am also happy to receive individual documents or scanned forms where necessary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DJ Smith

communications.communication:

All records, correspondence, emails, reports, memoranda, meeting notes, and other materials regarding the Lorane, Oregon Post Office (located in Lane County, ZIP Code 97451).

Specifically, I request all documents that pertain to:
• The current operational status of the Lorane Post Office, including any temporary or permanent closures;

Please include both internal communications and any communications with external stakeholders, including the USPS, local government entities, or members of the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: 8 USC § 1182(a)(3)(C)(iv) Notifications to House and Senate

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

8 USC § 1182(a)(3)(C)(iv) provides: "If a determination is made under clause (iii) with respect to an alien, the Secretary of State must notify on a timely basis the chairmen of the Committees on the Judiciary and Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives and of the Committees on the Judiciary and Foreign Relations of the Senate of the identity of the alien and the reasons for the determination." 

I request a copy of any notification required under 8 USC § 1182(a)(3)(C)(iv) that was provided to the chair of the Committee of the Judiciary of the House of Representatives, the chair of the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives, the chair of the Committee on the Judiciary of teh Senate, and/or the chair of the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate. This request is limited to notifications provided on or after January 1, 1990.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 22 CFR § 171.12(d)(1)(ii) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's involvement in the revocation of a visa or green card due to protest activity. The requested information relates to prior instances of determinations by the Secretary of State that a person within or seeking admission to the United States  would have potentially serious adverse foreign policy consequences for the United States.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic. Information of this nature has also been requested by a United States District Court in a high-profile litigation, which has attracted significant media attention. See Khalil v. Joyce, No. 2:25-cv-01963 (D.N.J.) at ECF No. 231.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

a. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/10/us/trump-rubio-khalil-columbia-student-protests.html
b. https://apnews.com/article/columbia-university-mahmoud-khalil-ice-15014bcbb921f21a9f704d5acdcae7a8
c. https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-authorities-arrest-palestinian-student-protester-columbia-university-students-2025-03-09/
d. https://www.columbiaspectator.com/news/2025/03/09/palestinian-activist-mahmoud-khalil-sipa-24-detained-by-immigration-and-customs-enforcement-lawyer-says/
e. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/09/ice-arrests-palestinian-activist-columbia-protests
f. https://nypost.com/2025/03/09/us-news/ice-arrests-palestinian-leader-of-columbias-anti-israel-protests-lawyer/
g. https://zeteo.com/p/breaking-dhs-detains-palestinian
h. https://www.dropsitenews.com/p/dhs-detains-columbia-university-student-gaza
i. https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-14478989/pro-palestinian-Columbia-graduate-arrested-ICE-campus-protests.html
j. https://www.insidehighered.com/news/government/politics-elections/2025/02/04/trumps-antisemitism-order-leaves-many-questions
k. https://reason.com/volokh/2025/02/03/may-aliens-be-deported-based-on-their-speech/
l. https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/02/02/trumps-antisemitism-order-puts-foreign-students-and-us-colleges-on-notice/
m. https://nypost.com/2025/02/01/opinion/deporting-pro-terror-protestors-will-to-restore-order-to-lawless-campuses/
n. https://www.npr.org/2025/01/30/g-s1-45468/trump-antisemitism-executive-order-protests-deport-hamas
o. https://www.jta.org/2025/01/30/politics/trumps-order-on-antisemitism-suggests-deporting-non-citizen-campus-activists-dividing-jewish-groups

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 22 CFR § 171.16(j), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by United States officials in response to campus protests.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all records in your possession from January 1, 2014, through the present concerning complaints, investigations, or regulatory actions involving Safety National Casualty Corporation, including any affiliated entities such as Safety Specialty Insurance Company and Sedgwick Claims Management Services, Inc.

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all records in your possession from January 1, 2014, through the present concerning complaints, investigations, or regulatory actions involving Safety National Casualty Corporation, including any affiliated entities such as Safety Specialty Insurance Company and Sedgwick Claims Management Services, Inc.

title: Public Records Request - Jeffrey Alan Lincoln

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Jeffrey Alan Lincoln
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://cbsaustin.com/news/nation-world/jeffrey-alan-lincoln-florida-dui-driving-intoxicated-repeat-offender-criminal-history-jail-told-charges-arrests-carried-car-deputy-vodka-bottle-traffic-stop-pickup-truck-drinking-lanes-yelling-marion-brevard-broward-county-breath-test-sheriff-office

Exact date of incident: June 30, 2024
Names of parties involved: Jeffrey Alan Lincoln


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.subject: FW: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Jeffrey Alan Lincoln
communications.communication:
Good morning,
Attached is the invoice for the requested bodycam footage. We must receive payment before the files are processed, we only accept business checks, money orders or cash. Payments can be mailed to the address listed at the bottom of the invoice. Please include a copy of the invoice with your payment. Once payment is received, the files will be processed, and you will receive a download link that will allow you to download the requested footage.
If you have any questions or need to adjust your request, please reply to this email.
Thank you and have a great day!


Sarah Dykstra
Body Worn Camera Technician
Administrative Services Bureau
Office of the Sheriff, Marion County
Desk: (352) 369-6759

title: IL Film Office - Instances of Tax Credit Reductions by Tax Credit Manager

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: IL Film Office - Instances of Tax Credit Reductions by Tax Credit Manager
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Related to the Illinois Film Production Services Tax Credit program:

All instances from January 1, 2022 to the present in which the Tax Credit Manager (currently Cesar Lopez) reduced the final approved tax credit amount for a film or television production, compared to the preliminary amount recommended or forwarded by the Assistant Tax Credit Program Manager (currently Michele McGee).

For each such instance, I am requesting any record that contains the following information:

Name of the production

Name of the production company

The preliminary estimated tax credit amount submitted by the Assistant Tax Credit Program Manager

The final tax credit amount approved by the Tax Credit Manager

Any internal memos, emails, worksheets, cover letters, or summaries showing or explaining the reduction in the credit amount

These records may include, but are not limited to:

Final determination forms

Memos of adjustment

Email correspondence regarding tax credit amount changes

Summary or audit review reports attached to CPA attestation packets

I request that these documents be provided in digital format (PDFs or similar) and sent via email or downloadable file link, if possible.

If redactions are necessary under any applicable exemption, please provide the redacted documents along with a clear citation of the exemption(s) used, as required under 5 ILCS 140/9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DJ Smith

title: Body Camera Footage – Officer Gregory Ceraso (Dec 2023–Feb 2024 Incidents)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Body Camera Footage – Officer Gregory Ceraso (Dec 2023–Feb 2024 Incidents)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Unredacted body-worn camera and dash camera footage, including all associated audio, recorded by Officer Gregory C. Ceraso during the following three incidents. Each is referenced in the department’s internal complaint log titled “Redacted Ceraso Complaints 11232023 to 03062025,” released on March 1, 2025:

	1.	December 14, 2023 – Traffic stop in which Officer Ceraso reportedly drew his firearm. Referenced on pages 2–3 of the complaint log.

	2.	January 9, 2024 – Citation-related stop involving reported unprofessional or threatening verbal conduct. Referenced on page 5.

	3.	February 22, 2024 – Welfare check involving a complaint of inappropriate verbal interaction. Referenced on page 7.

Please include the full duration of each incident, from initial contact to the conclusion of the officer’s interaction with the citizen, including:
	•	Body-worn camera video/audio
	•	In-car/dash camera video/audio
	•	Any accompanying dispatcher audio or notes, if available

This request is submitted under the Texas Public Information Act. I respectfully remind the department of its obligations under:
	•	Texas Government Code §552.221(d): A response is required within 10 business days.
	•	§552.301(b): If the department seeks to withhold material, it must cite specific legal exemptions and request an AG ruling.
	•	§552.222: The department must make a good faith effort to clarify, not reject, a request.
	•	§552.228(a): Requested material must be provided in the requested format when available (digital preferred).
	•	Texas Occupations Code §1701.661(f): Body-worn camera and vehicle footage in incidents involving complaints or use of force are subject to release.

If any footage is unavailable, please include the records retention schedule and the reason for unavailability, per Texas Local Government Code §203.041.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin

title: Foia Request-Investments

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Foia Request-Investments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I am currently seeking updated quarterly performance data from Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System alternative asset holdings for the following date(s): 1Q25

As always, thank you in advance for the time you take in sending me the responsive documents. Please feel free to let me know if there is anything i can do on my side to make this process easier for you.

On behalf of PitchBook Data, Inc., under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act,I request a copy of the quarterly public record from 1Q25 from the following information, preferably in Excel or PDF format.

1. Names and vintage years of all private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships in your plan’s portfolio.
2. Commitments made to each partnership.
3. Contributions drawn down since inception.
4. Distributions made to Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System to date by each individual partnership.
5. Net Asset Value of each partnership.
6. Internal rates of return (IRRs) for each partnership with and without the use of credit facility. Please note if the IRRs are not net.
7. Investment multiple (TV/PI) for each individual partnership.
8. The dollar amount of “total management fees and costs paid” for each individual partnership.
9. Date as of which all the above data was calculated.
10. Names of all alternative asset partnerships partially and fully sold by Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System including date of sale.
11. For each fund, please indicate whether or not the fund uses Subscription Credit Facilities.

I also request a copy of any disclosable documents which contain some or all of the following information:
12. Names of all hedge fund holdings (including hedge fund of funds) in Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System portfolio.
13. Month by Month Market Value for each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System initial investment up to 1Q25.
14. Month by Month Contributions to each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System initial investment up to 1Q25.
15. Month by Month Returns (net of fees) earned by Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System for each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since initial investment up to 1Q25.
16. Investment memorandum used by the Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System investment committee and investment consultants providing consultation to the Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System regarding private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships being considered for investment by the Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System portfolio.
17. All due diligence materials and presentation materials produced by the General Partners in the course of the Kent District Library Employees’ Retirement System conducting due diligence on investments into any private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships.
18. For each fund, please indicate whether or not the fund uses Subscription Credit Facilities.
If there are any fees for searching for, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before you task the request. If you deny all or any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Best Regards,
Roshan

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jake Hujar

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Thank you for your assistance. I will give that contact a try. 

Additionally, could I request the name(s) and contact information for IDOC personnel who oversee mental health programming or coordinate external rehabilitative initiatives, particularly those involving mindfulness, trauma-informed care, or wellness programming? These individuals would be the Indiana government counterparts responsible for overseeing the relationship with Centurion.

I’m currently conducting outreach to explore interest in offering a free, evidence-based meditation program for incarcerated individuals. To do so responsibly, I’d like to speak with the appropriate individuals — whether within Centurion or IDOC — to understand if this might be aligned with existing priorities.

I’m not requesting any confidential records, only public-facing professional contact information.

Thanks again for your time and support.

Warmly,
Andrew Ma
Vipassana Prison Trust

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #MR 186605
communications.communication:
Dear Matt,

Thank you for your quick assistance.

I understand that Missouri DOC contracts its medical and mental health services through Centurion Health. I’m reaching out to respectfully request the following:
	1.	The name and email address of the relevant Centurion Health point of contact for mental or behavioral health services in Missouri DOC facilities.
	2.	The name(s) and contact information for MDOC personnel who oversee mental health programming or coordinate external rehabilitative initiatives, particularly those involving mindfulness, trauma-informed care, or wellness programming.

I’m currently conducting outreach to explore interest in offering a free, evidence-based meditation program for incarcerated individuals. To do so responsibly, I’d like to speak with the appropriate individuals — whether within Centurion or MDOC — to understand if this might be aligned with existing priorities.

I’m not requesting any confidential records, only public-facing professional contact information.

Thanks again for your time and support.

Warmly,
Andrew Ma
Vipassana Prison Trust

communications.communication:

You will need to search for the following contract information:
CS210318001 for Centurion.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Mr. Ma,

This is to confirm that our office received your request and informing you that we are currently working on obtaining records pertaining to your request and will need additional time. This request will need to be handled through the following process.

Pursuant to HRS §92F, and the Office of information Practices Administrative Rules, §2-71-19, when a person requests access to a government record under Part II of Chapter 92F, HRS, the agency may charge the requester:

(a) (1) Fees for searching, reviewing, and segregating the record; provided that these fees shall be assessed in accordance with this chapter; and
(b) An agency may require a requester to prepay the following before an agency begins the search for and review of records in order to respond to a request for access:

(1) Fifty percent of the total estimated fees for searching, for reviewing, and segregating records when the estimated fees exceed $30;
(2) One hundred percent of the estimated fees from previous requests, including abandoned requests, in accordance with subsection (d).

Accordingly, in any request for information to DCR, the following charges apply for responsive documents: 1) @2.50 for each 15-minute period of search time; 2) $5.00 for each 15-minute period of review time and segregation; and 3) $0.50 per page for documents copied/digitized. The information that you seek is not readily available and will require a manual search, review, and segregation time. The estimated cost cannot be calculated at this time as I need a response from the section where we would obtain this information from. I will keep you updated as soon as I can, you will be notified of the final balance with payment due prior to releasing the information should there be any.

Thank you,
Cheyenne Evans
Department of Corrections & Rehabilitation
Litigation Coordination Office
Acting Departmental Program Officer / PREA Coordinator
Certified DOJ PREA Auditor
1177 Alakea St.
Honolulu, HI 96813

This email (including attachments) is covered by the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 USC 2510-2521 and is confidential.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any retention, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited.  This electronic transmission is for the sole use of those identified by the author and is the property of the author.  Any further distribution or copying of this message is prohibited by law.  If you received this in error, please notify the author and destroy the message immediately.

communications.subject: RTKL 0568-25 Interim Response
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Ma,

This email acknowledges receipt by the Department of Corrections (the Department) of your written request for records under the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law (RTKL). Your request was received on May 15, 2025.

In accordance with the RTKL, you are hereby notified that, for the reason set forth below, the Department is extending the final response date of your request to June 23, 2025.


  *   The extent or nature of the request precludes a response within the required time period.

At this time, the Department is unable to provide you with an estimated cost to fulfill your current request if it is granted.  Any actual or estimated fees will be identified in the Department's future response.

Sincerely,

Yihsien Han

Governor's Office of General Counsel
1920 Technology Parkway
Mechanicsburg, PA 17050

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R039453-051525
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Ma: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Florida Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/15/2025 10:26:27 PM and given the reference number R039453-051525 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-corrections-3972%252Frequest-for-correctional-mental-health-staff-directory-and-contact-information-department-of-corrections-186616%252F%253Femail%253Dfloridadoc%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAWMOa3jYPTuyLzlUJyKbyIC_8%3A1uFkkr%3Arkq6-d290xDjFQYQ87L9NsNAgaqY9TtWYMJyMZ3OV84 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Florida Department of Corrections Public Records Portal. 
Florida Department of Corrections To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Florida Department of Corrections Public Records Portal at

Track the issue status and respond at: https://floridadoc.govqa.us/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=39453
